Docs.summary: Defines a set of methods and properties used to examine a data source.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Classes that implement the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceSchema> class are used by custom control designer components to provide lists of views in a data source for data-bound controls at design time. In a class that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceSchema>, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceSchema.GetViews%2A> method to get an array of IDataSourceViewSchema objects.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.XmlDocumentSchema> class implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceViewSchema> interface. It uses its implementation of the GetChildren method to create an array of <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceViewSchema> objects.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetSchema> class implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceViewSchema> interface; its implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetViewSchema.GetFields%2A> method returns an array of <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema> objects, each of which derives from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema> interface.
